name: NIST Cybersecurity Framework for OT
description: NIST Cybersecurity Framework adapted for Operational Technology environments, focusing on identifying, protecting, detecting, responding to, and recovering from cyber threats to industrial control systems.

Safety_Critical.name: Safety Instrumented Systems (SIS)
Safety_Critical.description: Emergency shutdown systems, safety PLCs, and systems that prevent hazardous conditions

Process_Critical.name: Production Control Systems
Process_Critical.description: Systems that directly control production processes - downtime has immediate operational impact

Operations.name: Operations and Engineering
Operations.description: Engineering workstations, HMIs, and systems used by operations personnel

Business.name: Business and Enterprise
Business.description: Corporate IT systems with access to production data for business decisions

Remote_Access.name: Remote Access Zone
Remote_Access.description: Controlled access for vendors, remote engineers, and third-party support

Identify.description: Develop organizational understanding to manage cybersecurity risk to systems, people, assets, data, and capabilities

Protect.description: Develop and implement appropriate safeguards to ensure delivery of critical services
requirements: Data security at rest and in transit

Detect.description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to identify occurrence of cybersecurity events

Respond.description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to take action regarding detected cybersecurity incidents

Recover.description: Develop and implement appropriate activities to maintain resilience and restore capabilities

allowed_communications.rationale: Operations must monitor and control production

prohibited_communications.rationale: IT systems must not have direct access to production control
Safety systems must be isolated - no network connectivity except certified safety networks
Remote access to safety systems is prohibited

required_enforcement_points.rationale: Safety systems must be physically separate
Deep packet inspection for industrial protocols required
All remote access must be logged and monitored
